description.author: itomato
description.specification: A basic openSUSE 11.1 system, with an X-Server providing a minimal graphical user interface.

extra_config.name: OpenShoppe
extra_config.build_script:
#!/bin/bash # # This script is executed at the end of appliance creation. Here you can do # one-time actions to modify your appliance before it is ever used, like # removing files and directories to make it smaller, creating symlinks, # generating indexes, etc. # # The 'kiwi_type' variable will contain the format of the appliance (oem = # disk image, vmx = VMware, iso = CD/DVD, xen = Xen). #
# read in some variables . /studio/profile
sed -i '/^$/d' /etc/issue echo -e "OpenLPOS - Client - $(date)\n" >> /etc/issue
cat >> /etc/issue << EOF ******* ******** **** **** ******* /**////** /**///// /**/** **/** **/////** /** /**/** /**//** ** /** ** //** /** /**/******* /** //*** /**/** /** /** /**/**//// /** //* /**/** /** /** ** /** /** / /**//** ** /******* /********/** /** //******* /////// //////// // // ///////
---------------------------------------------- USEFUL THINGS TO DO: - POS Software lives in '/opt' - Login as root or admin and run '/opt/AdminMenu/adminmenu' - Setup LAN: 'yast2 lan' as root - Install IS4C/Fannie: '/pos/lanedb_install.sh'
LOGIN as root, admin, or pos user with password available online @ http://openlpos.org ---------------------------------------------- EOF
#chown -R root:users /opt/freemercator
chkconfig apache2 on chkconfig mysql on
# Remove unwanted cruft
# Temporarily back-up the desired gnome and xscreensaver resources - then extract after deletion. tar -cvf /opt/OLPOS-screensaver-and-GTK-appearance.tar /usr/share/themes/G* /usr/lib/xscreensaver/barcode /usr/share/themes/OpenLPOS-GTK-Theme rm -rf /usr/lib/xscreensaver/* /usr/share/themes/* echo "Removing excess GTK and Xscreensaver resources.." tar -C / -xvf /opt/OLPOS-screensaver-and-GTK-appearance.tar chown -R admin:users /usr/share/themes/
rm -rf /usr/share/icons/default ln -s /usr/share/icons/OpenLPOS2009 /usr/share/icons/default
echo "Done"
########################## # Users and Perms chown -R admin:users /home/admin chown -R pos:users /home/pos
rm -rf /home/admin/.bash_history rm -rf /home/pos/.bash_history rm -rf /root/.bash_history
extra_config.boot_script:
#!/bin/bash # # This script is executed whenever your appliance boots. Here you can add # commands to be executed before the system enters the first runlevel. This # could include loading kernel modules, starting daemons that aren't managed # by init files, asking questions at the console, etc. # # The 'kiwi_type' variable will contain the format of the appliance (oem = # disk image, vmx = VMware, iso = CD/DVD, xen = Xen). #
# read in some variables . /studio/profile
if [ -f /etc/init.d/suse_studio_firstboot ] then
# Put commands to be run on the first boot of your appliance here echo "Running SUSE Studio first boot script..."
sleep 2 ; clear
echo "Setting ownership for FreeMercator" chown -R pos:users /opt/freemercator/ chown admin:users /opt/freemercator/bin/admin.sh
echo "###########################################" #echo " - Setting up IS4C/Fannie..." # echo " + Changing Apache Document Root.." # echo " +- /etc/apache2/sites-available/default" # echo " + chmod 655 /pos/installation/server_db-install ; /pos/installation/server_db-install" # chmod 655 /pos/installation/lane_db-install ; sh /pos/installation/lane_db-install #echo "###########################################"
echo " Neutering First Boot script.." echo "mv /etc/init.d/suse_studio_firstboot /etc/init.d/suse_studio_firstboot.neutered.$$" mv /etc/init.d/suse_studio_firstboot /etc/init.d/suse_studio_firstboot.neutered.$$ echo "###########################################"
echo -e "\n\n\n\n\n**************\n Running SaX2\n*****************\n" SaX2 fi
